result.execSummary:
The defendant Shaun Henry Reed was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 66 (sixty-six) days time served. 
If revoked: Huber release privileges for work and treatment ONLY.

miscConds.notes:
* No contact with victim's Aftab S., Fredrick J or Dimpale S.
* No new criminal violations arising to level of probable cause.

* Continue Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed  medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
* Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" counseling OR Anger Management, whichever is deemed appropriate.
* Cooperate with Dr. medications/take all medications  prescribed by the physician.
* Successfully complete any other counseling and/or  treatment deemed appropriate.
* Cooperate with standard rules of probation.
* Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
* Court waived costs due to defendant's financial instability.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random urine screens.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shaun Henry Reed

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant sentenced to serve 240 days in the House of Correction, concurrent to any other sentence, with credit for 66 (sixty-six) days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 24 months: If revoked: Huber release privileges for work and treatment ONLY:


CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
   
     *   Continue Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed
          medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.          
     *   Successfully complete "Batterers intervention"
          counseling OR Anger Management, whichever is
          deemed appropriate.
     *   Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
          and successfully complete recommended treatment
          including random urine screens.
     *   Cooperate with Dr. medications/take all medications 
           prescribed by the physician.
      *   Successfully complete any other counseling and/or
          treatment deemed appropriate.
     *   No contact with victim's Aftab S., Fredrick J or Dimpale S.
     *   No new criminal violations arising to level of probable cause.
     *   Cooperate with standard rules of probation.
     *   Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).
     *   Court waived costs due to defendant's financial instability.
.
20 day appeal rights given,

Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Rights and Pretrial Incarceration Credit; received and filed.

Defendant Shaun Henry Reed in court with attorney Michael Jude.  Defendant Shaun Henry Reed in custody.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31 on June 28, 2016 at 1:30 p.m. Per defense counsel's request. Defendant is in custody. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Michael Jude in court, defendant Shaun Henry Reed not in court, in custody, appearance waived.  Jennifer L Pickett appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: AMI
Defense requested modification of bail. State objects to request. Arguments heard. Court DENIES defendant request. Bail to remain as set. Defense is waiting for offer. State to provide a global resolution.   Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 31.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing.  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Shaun Henry Reed in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Shaun Henry Reed in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rifelj, Branch 31.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for June 3, 2016 at 08:30 am.
